title.narrative: HIF - Feasibility assessment of MCs and reusable pads as menstrual innovation in humanitarian programming

description.narrative: In Sub-Saharan Africa, many women and girls do not have access to appropriate menstrual health management methods (MHM) and often resort to using poor-quality methods such as strips of cloth, tissue paper, school exercise books, sanitary napkins, pieces of sponge torn from mattresses and bark cloth. The lack of appropriate MHM methods may impact on physical, social and mental well-being of women and girls. Women and girls in humanitarian contexts, may have fewer coping mechanisms, their access to usual MHM methods may be disrupted, and private facilities for changing, bathing and washing, drying and disposing of products may not be available.
The project aims to reach 2000 girls and women with menstrual health education and reusable menstrual hygiene products.

This research and implementation project aims to assess the feasibility to introducing reusable pads and menstrual cups as two complementary menstrual health innovations with different advantages that may suit the unique preferences and needs of girls and women. The project integrates these innovative products into humanitarian programming by Welthungerhilfe, Bidibidi Settlement.
